headline.main: Shares Rally on Hopes for Quick End to the Afghan War

lead_paragraph: Stocks rallied yesterday, with the broad market hitting levels unseen since late August, on expectations of a speedy conclusion to the war in Afghanistan. Investors scooped up stocks across the board as it became clear that the deadly plane crash in New York on Monday was probably an accident, not a terrorist attack. Helping fuel bullish sentiment were upbeat financial results from retailing giants like Home Depot and a positive forecast from a top semiconductor company, Texas Instruments.
abstract: Dow Jones industrial average climbs 196.58 points, or 2.1 percent, to close at 9,750.95; Standard & Poor's 500-stock index is up 20.76 points, or 1.9 percent, to 1,139.09; Nasdaq composite index climbs 51.98 points, or 2.8 percent, to 1,892.11; graph; chart (M)
